data.description: At Oracle, I work as a Software Engineer II, where I drive innovation in enterprise applications, specializing in full-stack development and framework modernization. I have successfully led the migration of 100+ Oracle JET components to a React-based architecture, significantly enhancing performance and maintainability. My role involves mentoring interns, optimizing CI/CD pipelines, and implementing high-impact features that directly improve user experience and scalability. From developing multilingual translation functionality across 8 modules to automating workflows that reduced manual effort by 90%, my contributions have streamlined operations and boosted efficiency. Additionally, I ensure rigorous testing and performance optimization, cutting regression issues by 40% and enhancing UI rendering speeds by 50%. With a strong Agile mindset, I collaborate closely with product teams, designers, and QA engineers to deliver robust and scalable solutions.

As a Software Engineer I at Oracle, I played a crucial role in building enterprise-grade solutions within the Cloud PMS - OPERA Cloud and Hotels Distribution Software. My focus was on enhancing system performance, debugging, and ensuring seamless UI/UX experiences. I contributed to feature development, system optimization, and large-scale framework migration while maintaining 100% feature parity with legacy implementations. During this phase, I deepened my expertise in front-end and back-end technologies, collaborated with cross-functional teams, and ensured error-free, scalable implementations that aligned with industry best practices.

During my internship at Oracle, I gained hands-on experience in full-stack development, working on high-traffic enterprise applications. My focus was on learning, optimizing workflows, and assisting in the development of scalable solutions for Oracleâ€™s cloud-based hospitality software. This period strengthened my technical foundation, improved my problem-solving skills, and prepared me for a fast-paced, product-driven engineering role.

At Appscms Technologies, I was responsible for developing three security-focused web applications, including Safe Pdf Kit, Safe Video Kit, and Safe Audio Kit. These tools provided server-less data processing, ensuring enhanced security and privacy for users. I designed and implemented over 10 core functionalities for editing, organizing, and managing PDFs, videos, and audio files, directly impacting end-user efficiency. This experience honed my ability to build lightweight, high-performance web applications while emphasizing data security and seamless user interactions.
